trans-unit.source: How to add a users to an elastic database pool
trans-unit.target: How to add a users to an elastic database pool

trans-unit.source: You must add a user with privileges to each db in the pool
trans-unit.target: You must add a user with privileges to each db in the pool

trans-unit.source: How to add users to an Elastic Database pool
trans-unit.target: How to add users to an Elastic Database pool

trans-unit.source: The **Elastic Database jobs** feature (preview) enables you to run a Transact-SQL script across a group of databases including custom-defined collection of databases, an **Elastic Database pool** or an **Elastic Database shard set** in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The **Elastic Database jobs** feature (preview) enables you to run a Transact-SQL script across a group of databases including custom-defined collection of databases, an **Elastic Database pool** or an **Elastic Database shard set** in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: To run the script, a user with the appropriate permissions must be added to every database in which the job will execute.
trans-unit.target: To run the script, a user with the appropriate permissions must be added to every database in which the job will execute.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Managing Databases and Logins in Azure SQL Database](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee336235.aspx) or [Adding Users to Your SQL Azure Database](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2010/06/21/adding-users-to-your-sql-azure-database/)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Managing Databases and Logins in Azure SQL Database](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee336235.aspx) or [Adding Users to Your SQL Azure Database](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2010/06/21/adding-users-to-your-sql-azure-database/)

trans-unit.source: How to add the users to the databases
trans-unit.target: How to add the users to the databases

trans-unit.source: First connect to **master** of the Azure SQL Database server where the databases in your elastic database pool reside and create a new login using the same credentials provided when installing **elastic database jobs**.
trans-unit.target: First connect to **master** of the Azure SQL Database server where the databases in your elastic database pool reside and create a new login using the same credentials provided when installing **elastic database jobs**.

trans-unit.source: Log into each database in the pool and create a user using the same name and password.
trans-unit.target: Log into each database in the pool and create a user using the same name and password.

trans-unit.source: The user must have sufficient permissions to execute the job.
trans-unit.target: The user must have sufficient permissions to execute the job.

trans-unit.source: This code must be run on each database.
trans-unit.target: This code must be run on each database.

trans-unit.source: The user must have permissions as well, sufficient to execute the script specified for the job.
trans-unit.target: The user must have permissions as well, sufficient to execute the script specified for the job.

trans-unit.source: Use the **sp_addrolemember** procedure to provide the user with the minimum required permissions for the script to execute succesfully.
trans-unit.target: Use the **sp_addrolemember** procedure to provide the user with the minimum required permissions for the script to execute succesfully.

trans-unit.source: Create and manage jobs, see [Creating and managing elastic database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md).
trans-unit.target: Create and manage jobs, see [Creating and managing elastic database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md).
